Sir Arthur William Peterson KCB MVO (22 May 1916 - 8 May 1986) was a British civil servant.
Born in Calcutta, Peterson was educated at Shrewsbury School and Merton College, Oxford. He was the younger brother of Alec Peterson, the educational reformer.Peterson joined the civil service in 1938. During the First World War, he served in the Ministry of Home Security. He served as principal private secretary to the Home Secretary, 1946–1949. In 1957, Peterson was a special adviser to Rab Butler, whilst Butler was Home Secretary. Peterson also served as Permanent Under-Secretary of State at the Home Office, 1972–77.He was Chairman of the British Refugee Council in 1981.
